sentences.english: He has been habilitated enough powers to oppose you.
sentences.chinese: 他现在已具备和你抗衡的足够力量。

sentences.english: You won't find a more sensitive rod on the planet!
sentences.chinese: 在这个价位上你很难找到一款可以和他抗衡的竿子。

sentences.english: Tactical atomic weapons were viewed as the counter.
sentences.chinese: 战术原子武器被视为抗衡手段。

sentences.english: Light finds her treasure of colours through the antagonism of clouds.
sentences.chinese: 光线在与云霓的抗衡中觅到了她五光十色的珍宝。

sentences.english: Chu and Qi were only able to compete with them.
sentences.chinese: 当时只有楚国和齐国能与之抗衡。

sentences.english: No company can afford to antagonize China.
sentences.chinese: 没有一家公司能与中国抗衡。

sentences.english: Rapid changes will provoke counterbalancing actions.
sentences.chinese: 迅速的变化将会刺激抗衡行动。

sentences.english: Mountains of sword send justice alliance, and the teaching counter.
sentences.chinese: 五岳剑派组成正义联盟，与魔教抗衡。

sentences.english: The dynasty continued the struggle with the papacy begun under their predecessors.
sentences.chinese: 霍亨斯陶芬王朝继承前代继续与教宗抗衡。

sentences.english: He countered my plan with one of his own.
sentences.chinese: 他提出自己的计划与我的计划抗衡。

sentences.english: It was similar to Zhang Xuecheng's constructing Eastern Zhejiang historiographic orthodox to compete with Han Learning School.
sentences.chinese: 此举与章学诚构筑浙东史统以抗衡汉学派至为相似。

sentences.english: Treatments to counteract the effects of cyanobacterial toxins in animals have not been extensively investigated to date.
sentences.chinese: 治疗抗衡蓝藻毒素影响动物调查至今尚未广泛。

definition: to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to be on an equal footing
to signal the musicians (in Chinese opera, by prolonging a spoken word before attacking a song)/(coll.) to challenge
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
to fit one into the other/to bring two things into contact
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
